properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms are possible tonight. Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms late this evening and overnight. These storms may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-08T14:00:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T03:01:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2740940171.2019
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season continues tonight as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northwestern Ontario from the United States. Minimum temperatures tonight are expected to be near 18 degrees Celsius. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Saturday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T15:00:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T07:01:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2003730975.2019
Area: Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution and deteriorated air quality are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires very close to Pickle Lake. These conditions are likely to continue into the weekend. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-08T18:54:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-08T02:55:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1067709287.2019
Area: Pickle Lake - Cat Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution and deteriorated air quality are expected due to smoke from forest fires west of Gogama. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is expected to continue through Saturday as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northwestern Ontario from the United States. Minimum overnight temperatures near 18 degrees Celsius are expected tonight and maximum daytime temperatures will be near 30 degrees Celsius Saturday. Cooler air is expected to arrive on Sunday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T18:56:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T02:57:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2409925107.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires. Smoke plumes from a forest fire east of Pikangikum have resulted in deteriorated air quality in the area. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-08T18:58:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-08T02:59:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3799581506.2019
Area: Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. The severe thunderstorm threat continues late Friday night, as further thunderstorm development taking place in North Dakota is expected to move into the Red River Valley and parts of eastern Manitoba overnight. Severe thunderstorms will be possible through much of the overnight hours. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T12:31:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T05:20:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1492099090.2019

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls this morning with wind gusts up to 40 knots, frequent lightning, hail and poor to very poor visibility in thunderstorms heavy at times. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Extremely hot conditions on Friday are providing for a favourable environment for severe thunderstorms to persist tonight and track northeastward across southeastern Manitoba. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T14:11:16-00:00

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system moving across northern Saskatchewan will bring around 50 mm of rain tonight. Rain, at times heavy, will taper off to showers on Saturday. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-08T18:03:06-00:00
